definitions.definition: a strong, hard metal that is made of a mixture of iron and carbon

examples.text: The frame is made of steel.
Small steel plates were attached to the front and back of the bone.
The bridge is reinforced with huge steel girders.
the advantages of building in steel and glass
Steel used to be important in South Wales.
The factories and **steel mills** have now almost disappeared.

definitions.definition: a long, thin, straight piece of steel with a rough surface, used for rubbing knives on to make them sharp
weapons that are used for fighting
having a quality like steel, especially a strong, cold or hard quality

examples.text: She felt a hand of steel *(= a strong, firm hand)* on her arm.
You need a cool head and **nerves of steel** *(= great courage)*.
There was a hint of steel in his voice *(= he sounded cold and firm)*.

wordOrigin: Old English stȳle, stēli, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch staal, German Stahl, also to the noun stay sense (2). The verb dates from the late 16th cent.
